versionA.text:
This is the last part, congrats! In this question, each of you need to provide parts of the answer to fulfill a shared goal. The correctness of the final answer is determined by both of your inputs. 
 
 Based on the information of question 1: 
 
 Twenty-two stroke patients performed a maze task. The mean number of trials for success was 14.7 with s = 6.2, the population mean (μ) for this task is 6.5. 
 
 You and your partner each need to select one value of either s or number of patients so that the new calculated t is half of the original value. 
 
 You are responsible to change the value of s=6.2. 
 
 The following formula may be useful: t = (X‾ - μ0) / (s / √n), where X‾ is the sample mean, μ0 represents the population mean, s is the standard deviation of the sample and n stands for the size of the sample.

versionB.text:
This is the last part, congrats! In this question, each of you need to provide parts of the answer to fulfill a shared goal. The correctness of the final answer is determined by both of your inputs. 
 
 Based on the information of question 1: 
 
 Twenty-two stroke patients performed a maze task. The mean number of trials for success was 14.7 with s = 6.2, the population mean (μ) for this task is 6.5. 
 
 You and your partner each need to select one value of either s or number of patients so that the new calculated t is half of the original value. 
 
 You are responsible to change the value of the number of patients. 
 
 The following formula may be useful: t = (X‾ - μ0) / (s / √n), where X‾ is the sample mean, μ0 represents the population mean, s is the standard deviation of the sample and n stands for the size of the sample.

option.a: change the number of patients to 30
option.b: change the number of patients to 40
option.c: change the number of patients to 50
